definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: I played a one-two with Welbeck and stroked it in.
sentences.chinese: 我和维尔贝克来了个二过一然后将球打进。

sentences.english: The player tries to get into the penalty box by passing a teammate who relays the ball back to him.
sentences.chinese: 球员将尝试利用与同伴的二过一配合突入禁区。

definition: to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
ten-pin bowling/bowling ball/(baseball etc) ground ball
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
an overhung door/a door that hinges upwards
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
